psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 146,5]]Blessed he whose help is the God of Jacob, 
whose hope is in the LORD, his God,
[[Ps 146,6]]Who made heaven and earth, 
the sea and all that is in them. 

Who keeps faith forever,
[[Ps 146,7]]secures justice for the oppressed, 
gives food to the hungry. 
The LORD sets captives free.  

[[Ps 146,8]]The LORD gives sight to the blind. 
The LORD raises up those who were bowed down; 
the LORD loves the just.
[[Ps 146,9a]]The LORD protects strangers.

[[Ps 146,9b]]The fatherless and the widow the LORD sustains,
[[Ps 146,9c]]but the way of the wicked he thwarts.
[[Ps 146,10]]The LORD shall reign forever; 
your God, O Zion, through all generations. Alleluia.

gospel.text:
[[Mt 22,34]]When the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered together,
[[Mt 22,35]]and one of them, a scholar of the law, tested him by asking,
[[Mt 22,36]]“Teacher, which commandment in the law is the greatest?”
[[Mt 22,37]]He said to him, "You shall love the Lord, your God, with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.
[[Mt 22,38]]This is the greatest and the first commandment.
[[Mt 22,39]]The second is like it: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
[[Mt 22,40]]The whole law and the prophets depend on these two commandments."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

first_reading.text:
[[Rt 1,1]]Once in the time of the judges there was a famine in the land; so a man from Bethlehem of Judah departed with his wife and two sons to reside on the plateau of Moab.
[[Rt 1,3]]Elimelech, the husband of Naomi, died, and she was left with her two sons,
[[Rt 1,4]]who married Moabite women, one named Orpah, the other Ruth. When they had lived there about ten years,
[[Rt 1,5]]both Mahlon and Chilion died also, and the woman was left with neither her two sons nor her husband.
[[Rt 1,6]]She then made ready to go back from the plateau of Moab because word reached her there that the LORD had visited his people and given them food.
[[Rt 1,14b]]Again they sobbed aloud and wept; and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law good-bye, but Ruth stayed with her.
[[Rt 1,15]]"See now!" she said, "your sister-in-law has gone back to her people and her god. Go back after your sister-in-law!"
[[Rt 1,16]]But Ruth said, "Do not ask me to abandon or forsake you! for wherever you go I will go, wherever you lodge I will lodge, your people shall be my people, and your God my God.
[[Rt 1,22]]Thus it was that Naomi returned with the Moabite daughter-in-law, Ruth, who accompanied her back from the plateau of Moab. They arrived in Bethlehem at the beginning of the barley harvest.
first_reading.title: Book of Ruth
